meanings.definition: The quality or state of being spoken or verbally communicated.
meanings.sent1: Her orality was evident in the way she captivated the audience with her storytelling.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, orality plays a crucial role in passing down traditions from generation to generation.
meanings.sent3: The orality of his jokes made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The orality of the ancient myths painted vivid pictures in the minds of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The orality of the language made it easy for the children to learn through listening.

meanings.definition: The transmission of knowledge, stories, or traditions through spoken language.
meanings.sent1: The orality of the elders ensured that the history of the tribe was preserved.
meanings.sent2: Orality was the primary method of passing down cultural practices before the invention of writing.
meanings.sent3: The orality of the bedtime stories made the children look forward to going to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The orality of the teacher's explanations sparked curiosity in the students' minds.
meanings.sent5: The orality of the ancient legends brought a sense of connection to the past.
